title: Chicken Stir Fry with Celery, Carrot and Cashew
description: This Chicken Stir Fry recipe is a Japanese-style Chinese dish. The flavor was modified to suit the Japanese palate – no garlic. You can consume a large amount of celery in this recipe. Carrots and cashew nuts add color and extra flavor to the dish. The sauce is thick and clear.
overview: A Japanese-style chicken stir fry with plenty of celery, carrots, and cashews in a thick, flavorful sauce.

ingredients.title: Main
content: 200g chicken thigh fillets cut into thin strips
250g celery cut diagonally to 5cm / 2” long pieces, 5mm / 3/16” thick
100g carrot diagonally sliced thinly (3mm / ⅛ thick)
70g roasted cashew nuts (unsalted)
1 tbsp oil
Salt & pepper
1 tsp sesame oil

ingredients.title: Sauce
content: 1 tsp cornflour/corn starch
60ml water
¼ tsp chicken stock powder
½ tsp sake
¼ tsp soy sauce
⅛ tsp salt

stages.title: Step 1
content: Add cornflour to a small bowl and gradually add water to dilute it completely.

stages.title: Step 2
content: Then add the remaining Sauce ingredients and mix well.

stages.title: Step 3
content: Heat oil in a large frying pan over high heat.

stages.title: Step 4
content: Add chicken pieces, season with salt & pepper and cook for 1.5 to 2 minutes until the chicken pieces start browning.

stages.title: Step 5
content: Add celery and carrot. Cook for 1.5 minutes, then add cashew nuts. Stir for 30 seconds.

stages.title: Step 6
content: Add the sauce (prepared in Step 2) and stir quickly as it will thicken fast. Ensure the sauce coats each piece of stir fry ingredient.

stages.title: Step 7
content: Add the sesame oil and quickly stir. Serve immediately.

notes.note: Instead of thigh fillets, you can use chicken breast. The meat will be drier than thigh fillets but it will be coated with the thick sauce so you will not find it too dry.
Before adding the sauce to the frying pan, ensure that the cornflour is well mixed in the sauce and not collected at the bottom.
